sentences.sContent: Scorn, bitterness, unprovoked malignity, gratuitous desire of ill, ridicule of whatever was good and holy, all awoke, to tempt, even while they frightened him.
sentences.sContent_eng: Scorn, bitterness, unprovoked malignity, gratuitous desire of ill, ridicule of whatever was good and holy, all awoke, to tempt, even while they frightened him.
sentences.sCn: 轻蔑、狠毒、无缘无故的恶言秽行和歹意；对善良和神圣的事物妄加嘲弄，这一切全都绘唤醒起来，虽说把他吓得要命，却仍在诱惑着他。

sentences.sContent: The little witch put a mock malignity into her beautiful eyes, and Joseph, trembling with sincere horror, hurried out praying and ejaculating `wicked' as he went.
sentences.sContent_eng: The little witch put a mock malignity into her beautiful eyes, and Joseph, trembling with sincere horror, hurried out praying and ejaculating `wicked' as he went.
sentences.sCn: 这个小女巫那双美丽的眼睛里添上一种嘲弄的恶毒神气。 约瑟夫真的吓得直抖，赶紧跑出去，一边跑一边祷告，还嚷着“恶毒！”

words.tran: 恶意的；恶毒的；蓄意的；怀恨的
[医] 恶性的；有害的；有恶意的

trans.tranOther: the condition or quality of being malign, malevolent, or deadly
